physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Episodic headaches, truncal sweating, palpitations, and pallor suggestive of a catecholamine-secreting tumor.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient II.8 experienced worsening symptoms with lower back pain, recurrent episodes of headaches, sweating, and palpitations, indicative of disease progression.

vital_signs.other: Urinary excretion of norepinephrine increased during hypertensive attack.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Preoperative abdominal ultrasound and CT revealed a left-sided abdominal mass. An extraadrenal paraganglioma with local lymph node metastasis was surgically removed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, urinary excretion of norepinephrine normalized, but at age 42, elevated levels were noted again indicating recurrent PGL.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Attacks of sweating, pallor, weight loss, and psychiatric disorders including anxiety, nervousness, and panic. Confirmed diagnosis of extraadrenal PGL secreting norepinephrine.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Six years post-operation, intraabdominal and bone metastases were detected, indicating disease progression.
